title: Ping was 37-40 originally, jumped to steady 90-92.
body: Not too sure what happened, I've submitted a ticket waiting on a reply now, but wasn't sure if anyone else has had similar problems? Really frustrating. Currently using Mediacom as my ISP.

replies.body: A sudden ping spike like that does suggest some kind of connection problem to our game servers, and it may be how your ISP is reaching us.  While you wait for your ticket, I suggest running a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader).  This will paint a better picture of whatever is happening for your case.  Let me (and your ticket) know what you find!

i  play at lan server, my overall ping surrounded between 50-60 that it's not high, but since patch 7.3 it raised to 90 and this last one (7.4) got me a huge packet loss  , about 1-2 secs delay and 140 ping (which in other games like dota or rainbow six you'll need to get about 300+ to feel the same damn thing) , so, when will riot stop blaming ISP's and just fix their servers?

I ran it and ended up getting this message over the last couple logs I ran. 

-Your average ping was 86 milliseconds, which means your ping was good overall.

The worst ping you experienced was 89ms. This indicates your connection was stable for this game.

Then ran the log for the ping I was getting yesterday and this was what I got. 

-Your average ping was 38 milliseconds, which means your ping was good overall.

The worst ping you experienced was 40ms. This indicates your connection was stable for this game

Thanks for the info.  How was the packet loss?  It does seem that something with your connection changed, so let's start off with our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot.   That should help improve ping or attempt some rerouting if needed.  Test it in a custom game and let me know the results.

I've tried everything on there, I've had the google DNS for a while, renewed IP. I've unplugged the modem/router, and I'm on an ethernet connection. I'm stable everywhere else but league is now consistently 85+ ping. Not sure what else to do, but it's most likely my ISP, and they're awful to try and deal with.

Bummer, thanks for trying though.  Hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) in this step so our tech team can continue helping out.  Grab our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) as well to grab some logs to attach to your ticket.  We'll reply back as soon as we can!

I have the same issue, I wrote to support, but they said it was my ISP how has the problems, that's not true because I can connect to any server and the ping do not go high, since patch 7.4 I have this issue...

I woke up tonight to find myself having this issue too. I'm from chicago and usually have a stable 16 ping, but now i'm at a constant 47-52. I checked my ping on all the other stuff i usually play and it comes back normal. I'm on a ethernet and with comcast net, dunno why the sudden change in ping.

You might be having an issue specifically reaching the game server, so accessing other things can run normally.  This can be a local issue or your comcast, so be sure to check your ISP's support page in your area to see if there's any issues.  Otherwise, run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to see if we can get an analysis of your specific case.  Let me know what you get.
